H.content: language most mobile, immovable, the absolute ground of all displacements
H.linkedContent: language most mobile, immovable, the absolute ground of all displacements

LOBL.content: chose has always signified, in philosophy, that which doesn’t arrive > hupokeimenon or rēs, substance to which accidents happen, not only its accident
LOBL.linkedContent: chose has always signified, in philosophy, that which doesn’t arrive > hupokeimenon or rēs, substance to which accidents happen, not only its accident

LOBL.content: its very not-happening happens to the “Come” in its pas de chose, procès, as arrêt de mort that can’t be decided, neither life nor death
LOBL.linkedContent: its very not-happening happens to the “Come” in its pas de chose, procès, as arrêt de mort that can’t be decided, neither life nor death

SPOM.content: figure of absolute hospitality: strange, familiar, inhospitable > quasi-transcendental “messianism,” materialism w/out substance, materialism of the khōra for a despairing “messianism,” a curious taste of death, a foretaste (avant-goût), curious of what it conjures
SPOM.linkedContent: figure of absolute hospitality: strange, familiar, inhospitable > quasi-transcendental “messianism,” materialism w/out substance, materialism of the khōra for a despairing “messianism,” a curious taste of death, a foretaste (avant-goût), curious of what it conjures

SPOM.content: for Marx, ghost is the autonomizing of a representation (Vorstellung) whose genesis and real grounding (reale Grundlage) has been forgotten
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, ghost is the autonomizing of a representation (Vorstellung) whose genesis and real grounding (reale Grundlage) has been forgotten

MSUBJ.content: btwn sub and tile [the “-ject”]: persecuting evils, haunting the supports, substrata, substances > Artaud never stopped exorcising, conjuring the fiends (suppôts), succubi, sorcerers
MSUBJ.linkedContent: btwn sub and tile [the “-ject”]: persecuting evils, haunting the supports, substrata, substances > Artaud never stopped exorcising, conjuring the fiends (suppôts), succubi, sorcerers

VM.content: face is most high because it is origin of space, kath’auto, “substance,” presence, ousia [Feuerbach on height, substance, face] [engenders set outside of set]
VM.linkedContent: face is most high because it is origin of space, kath’auto, “substance,” presence, ousia [Feuerbach on height, substance, face] [engenders set outside of set]

VM.content: Aristotle compares transcendental principle of good to chief of armies, overlooked that it is the Face
VM.linkedContent: Aristotle compares transcendental principle of good to chief of armies, overlooked that it is the Face

VM.content: humanism, separating man from animal, via analogy of God and human face [vis-à-vis Descartes, ambiguity of substance as concerns God and his creatures], is this not the original metaphor? Levinas’ metaphysical humanism
VM.linkedContent: humanism, separating man from animal, via analogy of God and human face [vis-à-vis Descartes, ambiguity of substance as concerns God and his creatures], is this not the original metaphor? Levinas’ metaphysical humanism

PP.content: democracy is like writing, Plato’s trial against democracy similar to that against pharmakon: excess, anarchy, orgy, flea market, fair, bazaar (pantopōlion); errant democratic man has no substance, not perverse in regular way, like signifier freed (affranchi) from logos
PP.linkedContent: democracy is like writing, Plato’s trial against democracy similar to that against pharmakon: excess, anarchy, orgy, flea market, fair, bazaar (pantopōlion); errant democratic man has no substance, not perverse in regular way, like signifier freed (affranchi) from logos

VP.content: for Husserl, that which is unnammeable is “absolute subjectivity,” a being of presence as substance, ousia, hypokeimenon > can name its attribute not its “absolute properties,” i.e. its substance [classical metaphysical scheme]
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, that which is unnammeable is “absolute subjectivity,” a being of presence as substance, ousia, hypokeimenon > can name its attribute not its “absolute properties,” i.e. its substance [classical metaphysical scheme]

S.content: Descartes’ cogito not exemplary precedent of existential analytic because sum is not questioned [leap rather than genealogy]; Descartes commits the thingification of the subject, positing (Ansatz) of subjectum or hypokeimenon, a substance or substratum
S.linkedContent: Descartes’ cogito not exemplary precedent of existential analytic because sum is not questioned [leap rather than genealogy]; Descartes commits the thingification of the subject, positing (Ansatz) of subjectum or hypokeimenon, a substance or substratum

S.content: three forms of indifference: 1) stone, vorhandene entity 2) positive phenomenon of Dasein 3) paralyzing indifference, that of Descartes, substantializes a “who” as existing in form of Vorhandenheit > #2 and #3, however, are of the same capacity
S.linkedContent: three forms of indifference: 1) stone, vorhandene entity 2) positive phenomenon of Dasein 3) paralyzing indifference, that of Descartes, substantializes a “who” as existing in form of Vorhandenheit > #2 and #3, however, are of the same capacity

S.content: Heidegger’s Destruktion of “spirit,” vulgar concept of time, Dasein’s substance is not spirit but existence
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Destruktion of “spirit,” vulgar concept of time, Dasein’s substance is not spirit but existence

S.content: for Heidegger, that which causes destitution of spirit is of spirit, is its double, its spectral duplicity; yet, this is not Descartes’ Evil Genius (böse Geist), the destitution, the demonic, comes from cogito’s substantializaton, accepts lies, destruction, doesn’t question (Schellingian)
S.linkedContent: for Heidegger, that which causes destitution of spirit is of spirit, is its double, its spectral duplicity; yet, this is not Descartes’ Evil Genius (böse Geist), the destitution, the demonic, comes from cogito’s substantializaton, accepts lies, destruction, doesn’t question (Schellingian)

FSW.content: concept of subject requires concept of substance (thus presence)
FSW.linkedContent: concept of subject requires concept of substance (thus presence)

PPHS.content: for Hegel, signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice

PPHS.content: philosophy began in West because China grounded itself to a halt w/out opposition btwn substance and subjective freedom, could not reflect
PPHS.linkedContent: philosophy began in West because China grounded itself to a halt w/out opposition btwn substance and subjective freedom, could not reflect

WM.content: trope and arkhē have their own metaphorical charge, resist every meta-metaphorics, values of concept, foundation, theory > fundamental desire for firm/ultimate ground (to build artifice)
WM.linkedContent: trope and arkhē have their own metaphorical charge, resist every meta-metaphorics, values of concept, foundation, theory > fundamental desire for firm/ultimate ground (to build artifice)

WM.content: Kant: Grund flows from, depends on, substance (Locke: support for accidents), not schematic but symbolic hypotyposes, expresses concept w/out direct intuitionism
WM.linkedContent: Kant: Grund flows from, depends on, substance (Locke: support for accidents), not schematic but symbolic hypotyposes, expresses concept w/out direct intuitionism

POS.content: voice is consciousness itself when phonē is signifying substance > signifier and signified unite, signifier erases itself, exteriority of signifier reduced by spontaneous proximity
POS.linkedContent: voice is consciousness itself when phonē is signifying substance > signifier and signified unite, signifier erases itself, exteriority of signifier reduced by spontaneous proximity

P.content: Kant: very depths of foundations (Grundlage) of principles is independent of experience: if not: ruin > Kant goes to bythos of abyss w/out knowing if it exists
P.linkedContent: Kant: very depths of foundations (Grundlage) of principles is independent of experience: if not: ruin > Kant goes to bythos of abyss w/out knowing if it exists

P.content: desire of reason, desire for the fundamental: desire to go to the bythos
P.linkedContent: desire of reason, desire for the fundamental: desire to go to the bythos

P.content: Kant’s intro (the foundation) came after he wrote Critique, tries to articulate critique w/ philosophy, Kant’s critique not metaphysics, it’s a crane (une grue) or dragline bucket (une drague) above the pit (la fosse), travaillant à gratter, fouiller, déblayer, looking to open up sure ground [compare to reading machine in Glas]
P.linkedContent: Kant’s intro (the foundation) came after he wrote Critique, tries to articulate critique w/ philosophy, Kant’s critique not metaphysics, it’s a crane (une grue) or dragline bucket (une drague) above the pit (la fosse), travaillant à gratter, fouiller, déblayer, looking to open up sure ground [compare to reading machine in Glas]

GSP.content: Husserl: norm of math found in mathematical, logic in logical, ethics in ethical
GSP.linkedContent: Husserl: norm of math found in mathematical, logic in logical, ethics in ethical

DIF.content: consciousness, self-presence—subject cannot be thought w/out reference to presence as hupokeimenon or ousia > subject of consciousness has always manifested itself as self-presence
DIF.linkedContent: consciousness, self-presence—subject cannot be thought w/out reference to presence as hupokeimenon or ousia > subject of consciousness has always manifested itself as self-presence

WAP.content: CIPH quasi-founded; self-founded (eminently philosophical concept), is anything ever self-founded?
WAP.linkedContent: CIPH quasi-founded; self-founded (eminently philosophical concept), is anything ever self-founded?

Gii.content: Descartes says: hand so unique to body, almost separable, substance unto itself
Gii.linkedContent: Descartes says: hand so unique to body, almost separable, substance unto itself

REST.content: point does not bring foot in contact w/ a surface, doesn’t spread out on a surface (the soles, the ground)—surface is lower than the foot, goes lowest (Derrida’s never examined this)
REST.linkedContent: point does not bring foot in contact w/ a surface, doesn’t spread out on a surface (the soles, the ground)—surface is lower than the foot, goes lowest (Derrida’s never examined this)

REST.content: Derrida on Freud’s shoe fetish: shoe replaces that which is lacking not because of its form but because of its directional situation > syntax of a movement upwards from le plus-bas ——“according to the circumstances,” [Freud’s bisexuality of most dream-symbols] also occurs acc. syntax irreducible to semantic or “symbolic” substantiality
REST.linkedContent: Derrida on Freud’s shoe fetish: shoe replaces that which is lacking not because of its form but because of its directional situation > syntax of a movement upwards from le plus-bas ——“according to the circumstances,” [Freud’s bisexuality of most dream-symbols] also occurs acc. syntax irreducible to semantic or “symbolic” substantiality

REST.content: hypokeimenon as underneath, what is the fundamental ground of subjectivity? [re: Van Gogh’s shoes]: the “sole,” the rhythmic pas de contact of a march/walk/step, the ground, what about veils, the stocking (le bas), as what’s underneath the text? [all questions re: the thing]
REST.linkedContent: hypokeimenon as underneath, what is the fundamental ground of subjectivity? [re: Van Gogh’s shoes]: the “sole,” the rhythmic pas de contact of a march/walk/step, the ground, what about veils, the stocking (le bas), as what’s underneath the text? [all questions re: the thing]

REST.content: Heidegger’s Origin of the Work of Art intends to lead beyond, or to, eve of constitution of the subjectum, a Schritt zurück (backward step) on road of thought [?]
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Origin of the Work of Art intends to lead beyond, or to, eve of constitution of the subjectum, a Schritt zurück (backward step) on road of thought [?]

REST.content: Heidegger: from hypokeimenon to subjectum, Roman thought takes over (übernimmt) Greek words w/out corresponding co-originary experience, absence-of-ground (Bodenlosigkeit) of Western thought opens w/ this translation > a transfer, über, over and beyond Greek experience
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger: from hypokeimenon to subjectum, Roman thought takes over (übernimmt) Greek words w/out corresponding co-originary experience, absence-of-ground (Bodenlosigkeit) of Western thought opens w/ this translation > a transfer, über, over and beyond Greek experience

REST.content: these words become ghostly (fantômatiques) doubles of themselves, leur simulacre légers, walk above/in the void, bodenlos
REST.linkedContent: these words become ghostly (fantômatiques) doubles of themselves, leur simulacre légers, walk above/in the void, bodenlos

REST.content: for Heidegger, metaphorical (?) ground, this is the originary and fundamental experience of the Greeks, more than hypokeimenon > the underneath of the underneath (le dessous du dessous): a thinking of the abyss not mis-en-abyme
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, metaphorical (?) ground, this is the originary and fundamental experience of the Greeks, more than hypokeimenon > the underneath of the underneath (le dessous du dessous): a thinking of the abyss not mis-en-abyme

REST.content: abyss: “un des lieux ou non-lieux prêts à tout porter de ce jeu”
REST.linkedContent: abyss: “un des lieux ou non-lieux prêts à tout porter de ce jeu”

REST.content: how that which is under hypokeimenon opens an abyss (change of direction) > a completely different topic: “more” carries away, thing no longer has value/figure of “underneath”
REST.linkedContent: how that which is under hypokeimenon opens an abyss (change of direction) > a completely different topic: “more” carries away, thing no longer has value/figure of “underneath”

REST.content: thing still hidden away, wrapped up underneath in its investiture (hypokeimenon, subjectum: both still hide or veil)
REST.linkedContent: thing still hidden away, wrapped up underneath in its investiture (hypokeimenon, subjectum: both still hide or veil)

REST.content: the hiding or veiling, figure of the veil, is drawn into undecidability by the hymen
REST.linkedContent: the hiding or veiling, figure of the veil, is drawn into undecidability by the hymen

REST.content: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)
REST.linkedContent: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)

REST.content: Origin an essay on the gift (Schenkung), one of 3 senses in which truth is said to come to its installation, institution, investiture (Stiftung), there’s also the “founding (Gründen)” > this truth which is also nontruth also opens onto the “abyss”

REST.content: remainder, instance of letting fall, this lowness: is it the foot?
REST.linkedContent: remainder, instance of letting fall, this lowness: is it the foot?

REST.content: Van Gogh’s scene: “make oneself a present of the remainder (Glas)”
REST.linkedContent: Van Gogh’s scene: “make oneself a present of the remainder (Glas)”

HST.content: substitution of hostage as un être-sous, être-dessous, not the beneath of subjectum, substantia, hypokeimenon but submitted (soumis), assujetti, to the height of the Most High (law above)
HST.linkedContent: substitution of hostage as un être-sous, être-dessous, not the beneath of subjectum, substantia, hypokeimenon but submitted (soumis), assujetti, to the height of the Most High (law above)

HST.content: substitution resists ontology, question of hypokeimenon, that which places itself “below,” underneath, the very proximate words substance/subjectivity
HST.linkedContent: substitution resists ontology, question of hypokeimenon, that which places itself “below,” underneath, the very proximate words substance/subjectivity

LI.content: for Derrida, ground is an undergound (slippery, shifting, mined & undermined)
LI.linkedContent: for Derrida, ground is an undergound (slippery, shifting, mined & undermined)

LI.content: structure of remainder, implying alteration, renders all absolute permanence impossible
LI.linkedContent: structure of remainder, implying alteration, renders all absolute permanence impossible

BSi.content: for Deleuze [?], bêtise is thoughtful, a thinking, a matter of thought, a thinking and thoughtful freedom (i.e. proper to man) > Deleuze’s bêtise has a relation to ground (also Ungrund) influenced by Schelling’s discourse on human freedom
BSi.linkedContent: for Deleuze [?], bêtise is thoughtful, a thinking, a matter of thought, a thinking and thoughtful freedom (i.e. proper to man) > Deleuze’s bêtise has a relation to ground (also Ungrund) influenced by Schelling’s discourse on human freedom

BSi.content: for Schelling, only man w/ his freedom can relate to a groundless ground
BSi.linkedContent: for Schelling, only man w/ his freedom can relate to a groundless ground

BSi.content: animal cannot be bête, not free, can’t come away from relation to ground
BSi.linkedContent: animal cannot be bête, not free, can’t come away from relation to ground

BSi.content: for Schelling, there’s distinction btwn being (Wesen) as Grund & being as existence > must be Wesen prior to any ground: Urgrund or Ungrund that would not be oppositional, absolute indifference
BSi.linkedContent: for Schelling, there’s distinction btwn being (Wesen) as Grund & being as existence > must be Wesen prior to any ground: Urgrund or Ungrund that would not be oppositional, absolute indifference

BSi.content: logics of closure/enclosure, the threshold, le seuil interdit, question of responsibility (a question of threshold) throughout a decade of seminars [Derrida’s]
BSi.linkedContent: logics of closure/enclosure, the threshold, le seuil interdit, question of responsibility (a question of threshold) throughout a decade of seminars [Derrida’s]

BSi.content: not only do we not have a key to threshold, deconstruction doubts existence of threshold worthy of the  name (threshold supposes indivisibility & solidity of ground)
BSi.linkedContent: not only do we not have a key to threshold, deconstruction doubts existence of threshold worthy of the name (threshold supposes indivisibility & solidity of ground)

BSi.content: threshold (seuil), sill, soil, sole, solum, ground > are these ever secure?
BSi.linkedContent: threshold (seuil), sill, soil, sole, solum, ground > are these ever secure?

OG.content: internal modification of phonocentrism (or logocentrism): Descartes’ cogito interiorizes ideality of eidos & substantiality of ousia; thereafter, objectivity takes form of representation, idea becomes modification of self-present substance, power of repetition in eidos/ousia acquires absolute independence, a substance in relation w/ itself, res cogitans, consciousness—auto-affection, lumière naturelle > surmounts the Evil Genius (Malin Génie)
OG.linkedContent: internal modification of phonocentrism (or logocentrism): Descartes’ cogito interiorizes ideality of eidos & substantiality of ousia; thereafter, objectivity takes form of representation, idea becomes modification of self-present substance, power of repetition in eidos/ousia acquires absolute independence, a substance in relation w/ itself, res cogitans, consciousness—auto-affection, lumière naturelle > surmounts the Evil Genius (Malin Génie)

OG.content: propositions of essence can never fit a scale (échelle)
OG.linkedContent: propositions of essence can never fit a scale (échelle)

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] in an archeoteleological concept of nature [eg. identification of word & song, avant et afin]: modification becomes one w/ substance it modifies: (nature & its other, archeology & eschatology, substance & mode, origin & genesis) > this logic wreaks havoc on juridical/methodological point of view, annuls difference btwn structural/genetic point of view
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] in an archeoteleological concept of nature [eg. identification of word & song, avant et afin]: modification becomes one w/ substance it modifies: (nature & its other, archeology & eschatology, substance & mode, origin & genesis) > this logic wreaks havoc on juridical/methodological point of view, annuls difference btwn structural/genetic point of view

EU.content: CIPH should question motifs of “depth,” “foundation,” “reason (Grund),” distinguish between “basic (fondamentale)” and “end-oriented (finalisée)” research [see p. 227]
EU.linkedContent: CIPH should question motifs of “depth,” “foundation,” “reason (Grund),” distinguish between “basic (fondamentale)” and “end-oriented (finalisée)” research [see p. 227]

EU.content: [CIPH] “basic,” “fundamental” research should cease being ashamed of itself [due to pressure from sciences, especially social sciences], research the “basic” around series gift/destination w/out returning to hegemonic structure > a “scheme” that never becomes “program” or obligatory “theme”
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] “basic,” “fundamental” research should cease being ashamed of itself [due to pressure from sciences, especially social sciences], research the “basic” around series gift/destination w/out returning to hegemonic structure > a “scheme” that never becomes “program” or obligatory “theme”

FV.content: depth is height, flows out (débouche) toward the high, precisely the mouth (bouche) in which is “incarnated” the Nous, Logos, phallic signifier > reason is reason itself, aura raison, logic of kettle (a check [traite] drawn from reason): there is only one libido, it is masculine in nature
FV.linkedContent: depth is height, flows out (débouche) toward the high, precisely the mouth (bouche) in which is “incarnated” the Nous, Logos, phallic signifier > reason is reason itself, aura raison, logic of kettle (a check [traite] drawn from reason): there is only one libido, it is masculine in nature

FV.content: one reason, male libido, altus, at the bottom of things—highest truth
FV.linkedContent: one reason, male libido, altus, at the bottom of things—highest truth
